memberdef.argsstring: (const q15_t *src1, const q15_t *src2, q15_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_mul_q15

parameterdescription.para: points to the first input matrix.
points to the second input matrix.
points to the output matrix.
number of the first input matrix rows.
number of the first input matrix columns.
number of the second input matrix columns.

detaileddescription.para: The 1.15 format input is multiplied yields a 2.30 format, and then added without saturation to a 64-bit accumulator in 34.30 format. Finally, the added output is truncated to 34.15 format by discarding the lower 15 bits, and then saturated to yield a result in 1.15 format.

memberdef.argsstring: (const q15_t *src1, const q15_t *src2, q15_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_mul_fast_q15

memberdef.argsstring: (const q15_t *src1, const q15_t *src2, q15_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_cmat_mul_q15

briefdescription.para: Multiplication of two q15 complex matrices.

parameterdescription.para: points to the first input complex matrix.
points to the second input complex matrix.
points to the output complex matrix.
number of the first input matrix rows.
number of the first input matrix columns.
number of the second input matrix columns.

detaileddescription.para: The 1.15 format input is multiplied yields a 2.30 format, and then added without saturation to a 64-bit accumulator in 34.30 format. Finally, the added output is truncated to 34.15 format by discarding the lower 15 bits, and then saturated to yield a result in 1.15 format.

memberdef.argsstring: (const q31_t *src1, const q31_t *src2, q31_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_mul_q31

parameterdescription.para: points to the first input matrix.
points to the second input matrix.
points to the output matrix.
number of the first input matrix rows.
number of the first input matrix columns.
number of the second input matrix columns.

detaileddescription.para: The 1.31 format input is multiplied yields a 2.62 format. In order to avoid overflows, the input signal must be scaled down by log2(col) bits, Finally, the 2.62 accumulator is right shifted by 31 bits to yield a 1.31 format value.

memberdef.argsstring: (const q31_t *src1, const q31_t *src2, q31_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_mul_fast_q31

memberdef.argsstring: (const q31_t *src1, const q31_t *src2, q31_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_cmat_mul_q31

briefdescription.para: Multiplication of two q31 complex matrices.

parameterdescription.para: points to the first input complex matrix.
points to the second input complex matrix.
points to the output complex matrix.
number of the first input matrix rows.
number of the first input matrix columns.
number of the second input matrix columns.

detaileddescription.para: The 1.31 format input is multiplied yields a 2.62 format. In order to avoid overflows, the input signal must be scaled down by log2(col) bits, Finally, the 2.62 accumulator is right shifted by 31 bits to yield a 1.31 format value.

memberdef.argsstring: (const q7_t *src1, const q7_t *src2, q7_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_mul_q7

parameterdescription.para: points to the first input matrix.
points to the second input matrix.
points to the output matrix.
number of the first input matrix rows.
number of the first input matrix columns.
number of the second input matrix columns.

detaileddescription.para: The 1.7 format input is multiplied yields a 2.15 format, and then added without saturation to a 32-bit accumulator in 17.15 format. Finally, the added output is truncated to 17.7 format by discarding the lower 7 bits, and then saturated to yield a result in 1.7 format.

memberdef.argsstring: (const q7_t *src1, const q7_t *src2, q7_t *dst, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_mul_vxm_q7

briefdescription.para: Multiplication of q7 vetor by matrix.

parameterdescription.para: points to the first input vector.
points to the second input matrix.
points to the output vector.
number of the first input vector columns.
number of the second input matrix columns.

detaileddescription.para: The 1.7 format input is multiplied yields a 2.15 format, and then added without saturation to a 32-bit accumulator in 17.15 format. Finally, the added output is truncated to 17.7 format by discarding the lower 7 bits, and then saturated to yield a result in 1.7 format.

memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_oprod_q31

briefdescription.para: Outer production of two q31 matrices.

parameterdescription.para: pointer of the first input matrix with a size of size1*1
pointer of the second input matrix with a size of 1*size2
pointer of the output matrix with a size of size1 * size2
number of rows in the first input matrix.
number of columns in the second input matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This function multiplies a one-column matrix with size1 rows, src1[size1, 1], with a one-row matrix with size2 columns, src2[1, size2], and stores the result into a matrix with size1 rows and size2 columns, dst[size1, size2]. It achieves better efficiency for vector-wise matrix multiplication than for regular matrix multiplication.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float32_t *src1, const float32_t *src2, float32_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_mat_mul_mxv_q7

briefdescription.para: Matrix multiply vector for q7 formats.

parameterdescription.para: pointer of the input matrix
pointer of the input vector
pointer of the output vector
number of rows in the matrix
number of columns in the matrix and the elements size of vector

detaileddescription.para: This set of functions provides basic matrix math operations. The funciotn specifies the size of the matrix and then points to an array. For example, the function definition for the floating-point is shown below: void riscv_dsp_funcname_f32(const float32_t *src1, const float32_t *src2, float32_t *dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t row2, uint32_t col2) where it can be transform to the two matrix. For the matrix 1 is a row * col matrix and the matrix 2 is a rol2 * col2 and the output matrix woild be different since the math operation. There are similar definitions for Q15 and Q31 data types.
